intro: Dudleya blochmaniae, commonly known as the Sierra foothill Dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a rosette growth form. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white during the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
